comment.author: 25453448@N02
comment._content: Not really a suburb of London, especially at the time when this photo was taken and London was much smaller in spread.  Goring and Streatley are closer to Oxford and Reading than London.

comment.author: 35014516@N03
comment._content: Darkroom Daze:  You are correct, Goring and Streatley are out in the countryside.  We will look into adding more specific locations to this group of pictures.

comment.author: 25453448@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/anne_loc] Glad that was helpful. Here is some further info for you that might also be of interest. The river is the Thames and I think this view looks north and upstream, with Goring on the right and Streatley on the left. (If the view were to the south, the scenery would be more steeply hilly and more wooded.  In fact, just downstream from the viewpoint and behind the camera, the Thames passes through the 'Goring Gap' - where the Chalk downs drop directly to the river banks on the outer curves of its river bends.

comment.author: 35014516@N03
comment._content: Thanks for the additional info, Darkroom Daze!
